Class Group

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Cell>
          • Group
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Cell>, java.util.Collection<Cell>, java.util.List<Cell>, java.util.RandomAccess

    public class Group
extends java.util.ArrayList<Cell>
    Group is meant to be used for dividing up the Sudoku grid. Checks to see if a board conforms to Sudoku rules should be done through this class.
    Author:
    sjboris, alamana
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • N

        public int N
        Number of values this group can hold.Size

      • groupVals

        public boolean[] groupVals
        Array of size N. True in spot i means that this group contains value i+1.

      • type

        public java.lang.String type
        Available types are row, col, and block.

      • name

        public java.lang.String name
        Unique name for the group.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Group

        public Group(int size)
        Basic constructor. Sets type and name to "". Every entry in groupVals is initialized to false. N is set to 9.

    • Method Detail

      • groupSize

        public int groupSize()
        Counts the number of true values in groupVals

      • serialize

        public java.lang.String serialize()
        type$groupVals$cellNames$name$ Cells and group values are separated with commas

      • addCell

        public boolean addCell(Cell c)
        Add the passed in cell to this group. Adjusts groupVals and then calls super.add. Always returns true.
        Parameters:
        c - Cell to be added
        Returns:
        true

      • resetGroupVals

        public void resetGroupVals()
        Sets all of the group's values to false.

      • valid

        public boolean valid()
        Returns true if the group doesn't contain any repeat values.

      • valid

        public boolean valid(int n)
        Returns true if value n is not in the group.
        Parameters:
        n - Value to check

      • addValue

        public boolean addValue(int n)
        Returns true if n was not a value of this group. False if it was.

      • removeValue

        public boolean removeValue(int n)
        Returns true if n was a value of this group.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.String s)
        Two groups are considered to be equal if they have the same name.
        Parameters:
        s - Other group name.
        Returns:
        True if the two names are the same.
